item.title: Dollar Recovers Only Marginally as 'Bearish Tone' Remains
item.description: The dollar edged up slightly after recent falls but it remains weak as investors retain their overall bearish tone toward the currency, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Gilt Yields Fall After Below-Forecast UK June Inflation
item.description: Gilt yields fell after data showed U.K. annual CPI inflation dropped more than expected in June, with some analysts saying the BOE could opt for a smaller 25bp rate increase next month, rather than another 50bp move.

item.title: Oil Inches Down as China Worries Counter Supply Picture
item.description: Oil prices wavered in Europe as the market balanced signs of tightening Russian supply against concerns of Chinese demand.

item.title: UK House Builder Shares Surge on June Inflation Drop
item.description: U.K. house builders surged after the latest consumer price index data showed a marked decrease in inflation to 7.9% in June, below expectations.

item.title: Gold Has High Chance of Breaching Resistance at Ichimoku Cloud's Top, Charts Show
item.description: Gold has a high chance of breaching resistance at the top of the daily Ichimoku cloud, which is currently near $2,000/oz, said UOB Global Economics & Markets Research.

item.title: SKF Keeps Sales Outlook After Second-Quarter Beat
item.description: SKF said it still sees high single-digit organic sales growth for the full-year after posting above-forecast results in the second quarter, with adjusted operating margin of 13.3%.

item.title: Microsoft and Activision Blizzard Still Committed to $75 Billion Merger
item.description: The companies plan to continue work to resolve lingering regulatory issues.

item.title: UK Inflation Drops More Than Expected
item.description: Consumer prices in the U.K. were 7.9% higher in June, while the core rate fell to 6.9%, a relief for the BOE as it gauges how strongly to react to stubbornly high price pressures at its next meeting in August.

item.title: Volvo Lifts Full-Year Market Outlook
item.description: Volvo reported a rise in adjusted operating margin to 15.4% in the second quarter, while deliveries rose 5%, and the company raised its 2023 market forecast for Europe and North America.

item.title: U.K.'s Stubborn Inflation Means More Pain for Homeowners, Renters
item.description: Consumer prices in the U.K. continue to rise at a faster rate than in most other rich countries, threatening fresh hardship for millions of voters ahead of a general election next year.

item.title: U.S. Rate Rises Have Hit the Yen Hard, but Now It's Staging a Comeback
item.description: Japan’s currency has surged against the dollar this month. Central bank moves look set to boost it further.

item.title: ASML Bullish on Outlook, Raises Sales Guidance
item.description: ASML said its second-quarter gross margin rose to 51.3%, ahead of guidance, and it lifted its sales rise forecast toward 30% on-year, predicting strong growth for 2023.

item.title: Handelsbanken Upbeat Following Strong Second Quarter
item.description: Handelsbanken posted forecast-beating net profit and net interest income in the second quarter, helped by recovering interest-rate margins, and said it remained in “a very good position.”

item.title: The Biggest Holdouts on the Five-Day Office Week: Bosses
item.description: Nearly half of the most senior workers are holding fast to their work-from-home days.

item.title: Sustainable Aviation Fuel Leader Talks Green Premiums and Impact of Tax Incentives
item.description: SAF remains more than double the price of regular jet fuel.

item.title: McSpaghetti? Inside McDonald's International Menu Strategy
item.description: While McDonald’s is well known for its burgers across the world, it has menu items in other countries that you won’t find anywhere else. Here’s how the fast-food chain crafts its unique global menus and why localizing them is key to its success.

item.title: Investors Are Feeling Bold Again
item.description: Tech stocks are rising, spilling into meme stocks. The cryptoverse is enjoying a resurgence.The market looks a lot like it did in 2021—right before stocks entered a deep slump.

item.title: Tech Stocks, Meme Stocks, Crypto: Investors Are Feeling Bold Again
item.description: The market looks a lot like it did in 2021—right before stocks entered a deep slump.

item.title: The SEC is investigating whether private-equity firm One Equity Partners' communications with investors about its past and future performance violated rules.
item.description: The SEC is investigating whether private-equity firm One Equity Partners’ communications with investors about its past and future performance violated rules.

item.title: Microsoft and Activision planned to continue to work toward completing their deal by sorting out lingering regulatory issues, people familiar with the companies said, as the merger's closing deadline approached.
item.description: Microsoft and Activision planned to continue to work toward completing their deal by sorting out lingering regulatory issues, people familiar with the companies said, as the merger’s closing deadline approached.
